title: Your genes may make you more attractive to mosquitoes
author: SECTIONS Your genes may make you more attractive
description: The study is built on previous research where it was shown that attractiveness to insects is based on differences in body odour.
cleaned_text: for body odour, according to a new study. Researchers from the London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine found, for the first time, an underlying [genetic](/topic/genetic)component to how attractive we are to mosquitoes and this is likely to be caused by genetic control of our body odour. The findings could result in the development of better ways to control mosquitoes and the diseases they transmit. The study is built on previous research where it was shown that attractiveness to insects is based on differences in body odour. People who are less attractive to mosquitoes produce [natural repellents](/topic/natural-repellents). It seems that this trait is genetically controlled, researchers said. A series of trials using 18 identical and 19 non-identical female twins showed that identical twin pairs were more similar in attractiveness to mosquitoes than non-identical twin pairs.
